document.title: Chapter 130. Texas Essential Knowledge and Skills for Career and Technical Education

ED6A74F3BDA84FE4BDBAC72D5D42FBF2.description: select equipment and instruments used to give medications.

F69045A1744B44E2A2459FD623497C1D.description: complete a prescription label with identifiers that are required by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration; and

43C2B3A481FE44A18D201F0D0B8A5173.description: calculate dosage using factors such as concentration of drug, weight of animal, and required dosage;

197BC6515E3C4F57BBD93E1D102F68D2.description: explain handling and distribution, protocol, and laws for controlled substances, including the U.S. Drug Enforcement Agency;

E713A83221E148A1850FB098EA5DC136.description: identify medications according to their classification, form, routes, and methods of administration;

52101305C1A74B389E317511DE93D6FD.description: The student identifies pharmacology-assisting procedures, skills, and objectives that are included in the job description of an animal care assistant. The student is expected to:

2B7BBFB06E104C9E974EA4ACE6A01116.description: identify and monitor equipment used in surgical procedures.

DBB949AFF1B44450A778E31DA6A2969E.description: describe care of newborn, orphan, and recumbent patients; and

92C9ABD8F2AB45CAB4B9ED7F0B7EC356.description: describe surgical procedures such as castration, dehorning, and docking;

03F8E84EB3DA475DB044E213641D0238.description: review skills involved in patient and surgical room preparation;

D864C85DDC724AC498E3A7B41035F8F5.description: describe methods used in the sterilization and preparation of small and large animal surgery packs;

B5A8C2AB599F4A5D854E2731BF9CA480.description: explain the protocol for pre-surgical and post-surgical care of a patient;

26DDE0C66AC241FD8D748E8ABDF6FBF3.description: The student identifies and discusses surgical-assisting procedures, skills, and objectives that are included in the job description of an animal care assistant. The student is expected to:

CAFBF7ADBB4B472990C66C72B4CA3FBE.description: describe skills involved in the reproductive and genetic evaluation of animals.

AD621A8993314D9A959086E2EE30E8A4.description: demonstrate therapeutic care such as patient observation, maintaining and administering fluids, applying bandages, caring for open wounds, and managing hydrotherapy and physical therapy; and

16624ABC71A0424390934D8E415E4CDF.description: demonstrate animal care skills such as administering medications, nail trimming, bathing, grooming, ear cleaning, expressing anal sacs, dental prophylaxis, enema administration, and identification of animals;

4ECE2316977F42A896A29CFFA9CDB165.description: discuss emergency protocols and describe first aid procedures, including cardiopulmonary resuscitation, control of bleeding, and treatment for shock, for small and large animals;

A20F2EDD250D4D13AAFBC67B36885275.description: explain the care, maintenance, and use of equipment and instruments found in veterinary practice;

934CFB5A4E3B440AA71557C6333F6571.description: The student identifies hospital procedures, skills, and objectives that are included in the job description of an animal care assistant. The student is expected to:

69651801EBB946F0B2F9655C6A209159.description: prepare microscope slides, preserve specimens, and perform several of the most common laboratory tests such as fecal flotations, microfilaria smear, and packed cell volume.

8D5704DC37414FCBB8AA33872E5F96C7.description: explain sensitivity testing and how to read testing results; and

0008774DBC974B7C9DC7D1E0761E4BD2.description: discuss normal and abnormal results obtained in complete blood counts;

125D50965B8A437D82447D6259CEA729.description: demonstrate the procedures used in collecting, handling, preparing, and examining fecal, blood, and urine specimens;

D936F4DD98AA49AEA1FAA979BE65C2B3.description: describe laboratory tests and explain the importance of proper laboratory procedures;

718E1CDBC4AF44EE8C89E42451F1B44C.description: The student examines various aspects of clinical hematology. The student is expected to:

4CA8391C092F4C5C93465E40C07C3C89.description: analyze the quality of commercially prepared feeds.

EBC3864C09F24537AA28E96EC1DF5D70.description: discuss feeding practices and feed-quality issues; and

C3D6E72E8A02426385DFCED88C967495.description: calculate energy requirements and formulate rations;

497D1D59559E4B9F80CC0BE61CAB88C4.description: evaluate animal dietary needs and feeding factors;

A49CF1C4CC384526A1DF80C90F0D9714.description: identify feed additives and describe how additives affect the food supply;

8664E92F630548F38CED34FB8DDA8E93.description: identify types and sources of nutrients and classes of feeds;

1E24AA78297E4C18B8225C2476DABC2B.description: describe the process of digestion in ruminant and non-ruminant animals;

5CA6A523380C4B13808345E3F638520F.description: identify the anatomy of the digestive system of ruminant and non-ruminant animals;

A7A8A780813F4EE4855D83404DEFD54E.description: The student determines nutritional requirements for ruminant and non-ruminant animals and communicates the importance of animal nutrition in maintaining a healthy animal. The student is expected to:

A2E4876B588448AEBD47468764CA72CB.description: demonstrate patient restraint and positioning methods used for imaging purposes.

3754BFEFA0294197A6BD45AFB6AE473B.description: explain safety procedures, maintenance, and operation of imaging equipment; and

3D7A23DA86334848913EA96A2E7CE458.description: identify imaging equipment such as an ultrasonograph, endoscope, electrocardiograph, and radiograph;

FCC01254B4004D8B8087877EBAEC3732.description: The student identifies imaging equipment and demonstrates how to safely operate and maintain equipment. The student is expected to:

43153854E3554D66974B6BCE38C75EBD.description: explain the regional approach to assess an animal's health.

E3593F7501CA42619EB9201ADC6B61E1.description: explain procedures for physical examinations; and

D5E59B8D354345E1BD452500A52DAC10.description: describe effects of age, stress, and environmental factors on vital signs of animals;

27EB37EA3A594603BA1B7B5A8EED8895.description: take temperature, pulse, and respiration for a variety of animals;

5889DC2EE27045CB87A013C9ED74E10E.description: recognize examples of abnormalities and relate them to their associated problems and illnesses;

1B83BF4FC5A74523BB2A3E8114E7692D.description: describe the characteristics and signs of a healthy animal;

0E28E97E2B544C33A415D826ABBC7555.description: The student evaluates an animal's health during a clinical examination. The student is expected to:

6EB0B30FFA2241558CB5EECB76C5346A.description: describe types of treatments for diseases and parasites.

CD56919393804471AF70854E8ACA0373.description: explain how parasites are transmitted and their effect on the host;

2FA67C4A8D6C4B08BC829D7EBBB7F9EF.description: describe life cycles of common parasites;

83B9486C81064A7CBC241CDC574DA045.description: identify internal, external, and protozoal parasites using common and scientific names;

0B6D3582F0F948C1BB52A22D6925359F.description: describe the process of immunity and disease transmission;

7DCE3FF3D75B47179E058C0AFF1029A2.description: explain courses of treatment for common viral and bacterial diseases;

5D330F9525AE45F4B1468F47296CA047.description: identify pathogens and describe the effects that diseases have on various body systems;

09B9B439C7CE4D97A0063DCBCA2E9FF9.description: identify factors that influence the health of animals;

78FFBD0D965044AEA27D3F193C90D3E8.description: The student evaluates animal diseases and identifies internal, external, and protozoal parasites. The student is expected to:

D6FBCC82A19C4B74ACF7F11AB74F7136.description: calculate and prepare chemical concentrations using mathematical equations.

F7E49393ACF04C2AABA7F8AB0F45A5D6.description: interpret data using tables, charts, and graphs; and

EF0BC1208F4E4831B4DF8DB322429EDC.description: solve word problems using ratios and dimensional analysis;

2F614F2F259E4ED3AAC8F95E4877D789.description: determine weight, volume, and linear measurements using scientific calculations;

195AD1E6953C4204AFB55C729015AF46.description: convert between English and metric units;

DD31D3FFCEAA4685B818561A671BA03B.description: solve veterinary problems by calculating percentages and averages;

D368F1A19868407E92178DB57FF5CC83.description: apply mathematical skills needed for accurate client assessment such as measurement, conversion, and data analysis;

01839E09FECB491E848BD740FA1F367B.description: add, subtract, multiply, and divide whole numbers, fractions, and decimals as related to veterinary medicine;

7381FA2325A942E1BB3991B172992820.description: The student performs mathematical calculations used in veterinary medicine. The student is expected to:

D9E033210DB24F0B8151C42074BB5E8E.description: describe normal animal behavior and vital signs compared to sick animals using medical terminology.

14207CC1987C42089FC7878F7E9B3973.description: identify appropriate anatomical sites for injections, measuring vital signs, and collecting blood samples for various animal species; and

A04AD823B4ED4C4482242844A4FD8239.description: describe the functions of the skeletal, muscular, respiratory, circulatory, digestive, endocrine, and nervous systems;

174CEA08E7AB4EF69B917733A05FCE5E.description: identify the parts of the skeletal, muscular, respiratory, circulatory, digestive, endocrine, and nervous systems;

59F05F750859451DAA5896447D4DD658.description: The student investigates the body systems and gains a working knowledge of each system's purpose and functions and how each system is affected by disease. The student is expected to:

02F8520B5A7B48EDA1D65164EE002F56.description: demonstrate appropriate methods of handling a variety of animal behaviors.

7FF038BFFC3E41E696DBE0F9E5809FC3.description: identify correct handling protocols and discuss their relevance to veterinary medical staff; and

60C136D16B2C4AA7B66CE1B4AFBF91D8.description: recognize common animal behavioral problems within companion, exotic, and large animals per industry standard;

553F29BB5ADB4CACB8A9CCB1C8D6B0E7.description: identify a variety of animal species such as companion, exotic, and large animal species according to common breed characteristics;

BD46E8D647F14E9EA380B67B13DD91D8.description: The student explores the area of animal management as it relates to animal identification, animal characteristics, and behavioral temperament. The student is expected to:

408F68AEC8AE4128ACF766C861B1D8F2.description: recognize, pronounce, spell, and define medical terms relating to diagnosis, pathology, and treatment of animals.

20FCC6E8F78A4527857EA0ED681549AE.description: describe the major body systems using appropriate medical terminology; and

F9575A384EC34E5C82E14A2826FAE553.description: analyze veterinary terms to discover their meanings and recognize common Greek and Latin prefixes, suffixes, and roots;

76ADB7EB28784B48BD023C809290E947.description: The student communicates the importance of medical terminology, evaluates veterinary terms to discover their meanings, and demonstrates the ability to use terms correctly. The student is expected to:

C98592F4122B4F428125C397CEA16B98.description: develop skills involving the use of electronic technology commonly found in a veterinary hospital such as centrifuge, autoclave, and radiography positions.

5C69EC9CB275418F9DB03177D58F5BEB.description: explain the role and importance of marketing and its effects on the success of a veterinary hospital; and

50E0435EA0924C9581AFE7BB57C10ABA.description: identify vital information and demonstrate effective communication skills necessary to solve problems;

B59186E491084ACB8D4EEAC5E7793F25.description: identify skills needed to communicate effectively with clients and pet owners in the community;

2F1A8BF6FEE146789B9D17E4E5893755.description: The student evaluates veterinary hospital management and marketing to determine their importance to the success of veterinary clinics and hospitals. The student is expected to:

A05588C6462A476EA72AE8F1B3B9A7A7.description: review policies and procedures in veterinary medicine that reflect various local, state, and federal laws.

866A727977BD44C8ACBDBC3E7CDFDD18.description: evaluate the principles of veterinary medical ethics; and

F0CF7C7E29534277BEC40284C1326ECE.description: describe the legal aspects of animal welfare and animal rights;

D3DCF19F68BE4927A4927942807E026F.description: identify trends, issues, and historical events that have influenced animal use and care;

89A30ECD0BED4D918DEBD165ADF26760.description: explain the human-animal bond and how to interact with clients and their animals;

1678E92FFE054CE8B1B30FA5389BF33F.description: The student researches current topics in veterinary medicine, recognizes the importance of animals in society, and discusses professional ethics and laws that relate to veterinary medicine. The student is expected to:

23169D988F6B44709420FFF20647B3A0.description: produce and participate in a local program of activities using a strategic planning process.

0740C654C1E040FD9B25C158495F3A8D.description: participate in youth leadership opportunities to create a well-rounded experience program; and

97CB07D9F876432BB599131779DEBD5D.description: apply proper record-keeping skills as they relate to the supervised agriculture experience;

35694C48F3F54957BAB0EE58A4910395.description: plan, propose, conduct, document, and evaluate a supervised agriculture experience program as an experiential learning activity;

6B30309A1D034A2F91067CF9A42524C8.description: The student develops a supervised agriculture experience program. The student is expected to:

671818EDC10F472596A1C4B50503E6A0.description: research career topics using technology such as the Internet.

2E3F0608D1954A8895DBFE588749CDBC.description: demonstrate characteristics of good citizenship such as stewardship, advocacy, and community leadership; and

84853BF2E1DE4AA6AC9A35034CFD3B2A.description: identify employers' expectations, including appropriate work habits, ethical conduct, and legal responsibilities;

68B656C74D7C47FB9B0AAD7237DEABCF.description: demonstrate knowledge of personal and occupational health and safety practices in the workplace;

143582EDE6A341299669AAE80EB3C94A.description: demonstrate competencies related to resources, information, interpersonal skills, and systems of operation in veterinary science;

6B7110399C154FE782CBD6E90F0654D4.description: identify career development and entrepreneurship opportunities in the field of veterinary science;

F09B8CADE42142EFADF08C9098BDF87A.description: The student demonstrates professional standards/employability skills as required by business and industry. The student is expected to:

2C78435CA0FC4969A85533AF36A2C842.description: Statements that contain the word "including" reference content that must be mastered, while those containing the phrase "such as" are intended as possible illustrative examples.

E5A6EE23AEBF4A23ACFF49F251CC331F.description: Students are encouraged to participate in extended learning experiences such as career and technical student organizations and other leadership or extracurricular organizations.

8E51A0B2CD2E4F7F8FB331F94BEDF443.description: Veterinary Medical Applications covers topics relating to veterinary practices, including practices for large and small animal species. To prepare for careers in the field of animal science, students must attain academic skills and knowledge, acquire technical knowledge and skills related to animal systems and the workplace, and develop knowledge and skills regarding career opportunities, entry requirements, and industry expectations. To prepare for success, students need opportunities to learn, reinforce, apply, and transfer knowledge and skills and technologies in a variety of settings.

58E5ED2462A9464EAF7BC980C150C2B9.description: The Agriculture, Food, and Natural Resources Career Cluster focuses on the production, processing, marketing, distribution, financing, and development of agricultural commodities and resources, including food, fiber, wood products, natural resources, horticulture, and other plant and animal products/resources.

43D4A1544D0E4874A18A29946D39DF61.description: Career and technical education instruction provides content aligned with challenging academic standards and relevant technical knowledge and skills for students to further their education and succeed in current or emerging professions.

BBA159C24BBE4DDAB6D14457D85510AE.description: General requirements. This course is recommended for students in Grades 11 and 12. Prerequisite: Equine Science, Small Animal Management, or Livestock Production. Students shall be awarded one credit for successful completion of this course.
